doc:
Julia Hurley (actress) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julia_Hurley_(actress) 0 Julia R. Hurley (1848, per her tombstone – June 4, 1927) was an American actress who found popularity in her senior years in silent films. She is best remembered today as the 'landlady with the lamp' in the John Barrymore classic Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde 1920, a role for which she is uncredited. This film is her most readily available film today. She worked for many of the early film studios i.e.: Biograph, Kalem, Essanay, Reliance, Imp, Champion and Solax. As with most people born in the Victorian era, Hurley probably enjoyed a theatrical career acting in provinces or regional theatre and touring before making her first film in 1909. She continued with films until 1926.She died June 4, 1927 of chronic myocarditis and nephritis. Julia_R._Hurley ( 1848 , per her_tombstone – June_4_,_1927 ) was an_American_actress who found popularity in her_senior_years in silent_films . She is_best_remembered today as the_'_landlady with the_lamp ' in the_John_Barrymore_classic_Dr._Jekyll and Mr._Hyde_1920 , a_role for which she is uncredited . This_film is her_most_readily_available_film today . She worked for many of the_early_film_studios_i.e. : Biograph , Kalem , Essanay , Reliance , Imp , Champion and Solax . As with_most_people born in the_Victorian_era , Hurley probably enjoyed a_theatrical_career acting in provinces or regional_theatre_and_touring before making her_first_film in 1909 . She continued with films until 1926 . She died June_4_,_1927 of chronic_myocarditis_and_nephritis .
